thread.title: Malware Helps Players Cheat at Online Poker by Taking Screenshots of Opponent's Hand
thread.title_full: Malware Helps Players Cheat at Online Poker by Taking Screenshots of Opponent's Hand - newsR

author: newsr.in
title: Malware Helps Players Cheat at Online Poker by Taking Screenshots of Opponent's Hand
text: PokerStars and Full Tilt Poker users are at risk of being cheated while playing online poker, and at fault is a new malware family called Win32/Spy.Odlanor, or just Odlanor. Discovered by ESET's security researchers, this new malware strand is focused only on online poker players, helping its authors win poker games by taking screenshots of the opponent's current hand. Infection comes through third-party applications Odlanor usually infects users that... Â»
